meanings.definition: To make low, whining, broken sounds.
meanings.sent1: The puppy was whimpering for attention.
meanings.sent2: The dog kept whimpering during the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent3: The baby doll started whimpering when its battery ran low.
meanings.sent4: The old car engine was whimpering as it struggled up the hill.
meanings.sent5: The wind whimpering through the trees created a haunting melody.

meanings.sent1: The whimpering of the wind outside made the house feel eerie.
meanings.sent2: The injured animal's whimpering could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent3: The whimpering of the teapot signaled that it was ready.
meanings.sent4: The whimpering of the violin added a melancholic touch to the music.
meanings.sent5: The whimpering of the puppy tugged at my heartstrings.
